《富爸爸．窮爸爸》作者羅伯特清崎講過：「太多人忘了去關注自己的事業，他們耗盡一世去關注別人的事業，並使他人致富。」我們希望尋找所有想為自己創事業努力拼博的人。

生於這個斜槓新世代，每人要擁有並不是十項全能，而是要構建自我創業思維。加入AXA長盛理財團隊，你會培養出做生意的創業頭腦，跳出聽上司指令的打工仔生涯，踏實而長遠建立屬於您的個人保險事業。

區域背景：

- 超過20年發展大中華地區市場經驗，區域人數達200人
- 成員來自不同專業背景，有前律師，銀行家，商人，IT專業人士等等，無論對高端客戶或是中產客戶銷售都有豐富經驗。

團隊背景：

長盛理財創辦人Sam當初決定裸辭創業，事業達到顛峰成就到生意失敗後，但卻無損建立事業王國的鬥心，決定由保險業開始東山再起，並最後僅用了兩年時間達到COT （即3倍MDRT）。

聯合創辦人Charlotte從事甲級商場租務超過10年，有感無限OT的打工仔生活未能兼顧照顧兩個年幼兒子，於是下定決心跳出comfort zone加入理財策劃行業, 自由工作模式讓她工作更有拼勁又多了時間照顧家庭，入職短短5個月便達標MDRT 2021, 今年亦已完成MDRT 2022！

長盛理財團隊深信保險不只是一個理財策劃的行業，而是讓每人建立個人生意的起步點。團隊成員來自香港，菲律賓，韓國，印度等等，不同文化思維助你開拓新思維！我們整個團隊會一直作為您的創業同路人支援你和協助你達成個人生意目標，建立自己的事業王國。

你會獲得什麼？

每月津貼上限HK$50,000，最高可達過往月薪之100%
完善佣金制度及營銷獎賞，包括每月佣金，每季獎金，年終獎金，海外業務會議等，獎勵傑出表現
全面培訓課程，提升個人競爭力，幫助積極轉行人士
清晰晉升階梯，積極配合事業發展
自主工作時間，平衡家庭和生活

工作範圍：

為客戶提供各項專業的理財方案，如健康保障、風險管理、退休基金、教育基金資產配置等
建立良好客戶關係，拓展客戶網絡，定期了解他們的財政需要及檢討現有理財計劃
為現有客戶提供優質售後服務及處理理賠事項

入職要求:

大學學士畢業或以上
或中五會考或中學文憑考試5科合格(包括中，英，數)或同等程度以上
渴望以合伙人的身份參與低成本、低風險的創業項目，打造屬於個人的品牌和業務團隊
處事成熟，具良好人際技巧

description:
Assistant Facilities Officer

About JLL –

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. As a Fortune 500 company, we help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. With us, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections and be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions - join us at JLL!

About the role:

Assistant Facilities Officer will be the gatekeeper of the site, he/she will be working closely with our security guards, receptionists and tea attendants, overseeing them and ensuring they carry out all works to a high standard to the client site. He/she will be looking after the relationship with all stakeholders – management, clients, vendors and landlords.

What this job involves:

How can you help make employees and visitors alike love our office? You’ll do so by arranging for regular preventative maintenance and repairs for our facilities. Scheduling for regular cleaning services and ensuring all office equipment are in good working order are a few of the tasks you’ll do to spruce up the office.
You’ll keep an eye out for potential emergencies and carry out steps for managing such situations. You’ll also perform established escalation and incident reporting procedures should such an event take place. Being on the lookout for opportunities to reduce costs and improve our operational standards should also come instinctively to you.
How important is security to you?  Security is a tall order and calls for an all-hands-on-deck approach. As such, we are always on the lookout for people for whom attention to security details comes naturally. In this role, you’ll help give an extra layer of protection by doing regular checks of our CCTV systems to review the need for maintenance and repairs. You’ll oversee visitor access—clients, contractors, vendors—and maintain logs and filing work of such information on a regular basis. You’ll not only be the “gatekeeper,” but also the “face of JLL,” acting as a back-up receptionist as needed.
As you perform a juggling act between helping safeguard our premises and giving a warm reception to our guests, you’ll be working closely with our security guards, receptionists and tea attendants, overseeing them and ensuring they carry out all work to a high standard.
Every business aims for client satisfaction—but we take it up a notch! If you can take in the same passion for looking after our relationship with all our stakeholders—management, clients, vendors, landlords—we’ll be more than happy to work with you. Because in this role, you’ll be a vital element in keeping our communication lines with them open and strong. One way to do so is to ensure everyone follows the established key operating procedures to achieve standards. Another way is to schedule regular meetings to understand stakeholder’s needs.

Sound like you? To apply you will have:

Do you have more than two years’ experience in facilities management? Are you driven by service excellence? Are you knowledgeable in budgeting and facilities security? We’d love to speak with you!
Excellent communication skills are vital—both spoken and written—as we’ll expect you to work independently in cascading high-level communications and boosting staff/client satisfaction. And if you know both the English and Chinese languages, that would be super! If you think you possess all these, then let’s work together and explore opportunities.

What you can expect from us

We’re an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. We succeed together - across the desk and around the globe. We believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, well-being, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.

With us, you’ll develop your strengths and enjoy a career full of varied experiences. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL.


Apply today!

description:
Assistant Facilities Officer

About JLL –
We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. As a Fortune 500 company, we help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. With us, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections and be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions - join us at JLL!

About the role:

Assistant Facilities Officer will be the gatekeeper of the site, he/she will be working closely with our security guards, receptionists and tea attendants, overseeing them and ensuring they carry out all works to a high standard to the client site. He/she will be looking after the relationship with all stakeholders – management, clients, vendors and landlords.

What this job involves:

How can you help make employees and visitors alike love our office? You’ll do so by arranging for regular preventative maintenance and repairs for our facilities. Scheduling for regular cleaning services and ensuring all office equipment are in good working order are a few of the tasks you’ll do to spruce up the office.
You’ll keep an eye out for potential emergencies and carry out steps for managing such situations. You’ll also perform established escalation and incident reporting procedures should such an event take place. Being on the lookout for opportunities to reduce costs and improve our operational standards should also come instinctively to you.
How important is security to you?  Security is a tall order and calls for an all-hands-on-deck approach. As such, we are always on the lookout for people for whom attention to security details comes naturally. In this role, you’ll help give an extra layer of protection by doing regular checks of our CCTV systems to review the need for maintenance and repairs. You’ll oversee visitor access—clients, contractors, vendors—and maintain logs and filing work of such information on a regular basis. You’ll not only be the “gatekeeper,” but also the “face of JLL,” acting as a back-up receptionist as needed.
As you perform a juggling act between helping safeguard our premises and giving a warm reception to our guests, you’ll be working closely with our security guards, receptionists and tea attendants, overseeing them and ensuring they carry out all work to a high standard.
Every business aims for client satisfaction—but we take it up a notch! If you can take in the same passion for looking after our relationship with all our stakeholders—management, clients, vendors, landlords—we’ll be more than happy to work with you. Because in this role, you’ll be a vital element in keeping our communication lines with them open and strong. One way to do so is to ensure everyone follows the established key operating procedures to achieve standards. Another way is to schedule regular meetings to understand stakeholder’s needs.

Sound like you? To apply you will have:

Do you have more than two years’ experience in facilities management? Are you driven by service excellence? Are you knowledgeable in budgeting and facilities security? We’d love to speak with you!
Excellent communication skills are vital—both spoken and written—as we’ll expect you to work independently in cascading high-level communications and boosting staff/client satisfaction. And if you know both the English and Chinese languages, that would be super! If you think you possess all these, then let’s work together and explore opportunities.

What you can expect from us

We’re an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. We succeed together - across the desk and around the globe. We believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, well-being, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.

With us, you’ll develop your strengths and enjoy a career full of varied experiences. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL.


Apply today!

紅磡海名軒

job_title: Senior Manager - Office Leasing (Reputable Property Developer in HK)
description:
About Rectrix 
Rectrix is specialist recruitment consultancy formed by a team of highly diligent recruiters with a proven track record in end-to-end delivery from mid to senior placements within the built environment industry.

About this Employer
Prestigious property developer based in Hong Kong with a brand which is reputable for developing and managing a premium commercial complex in Hong Kong. Upon recent business expansion, the Group is going to look for a Senior Leasing Manager to be responsible for the full-spectrum leasing management of the commercial portfolio for the Group. 

Responsibilities:


Accountable for the overall formulation of leasing & marketing strategies for office leasing portfolio in Hong Kong.
Manage and facilitate all leasing liaisons and coordination with internal and external parties including tenant management, leasing enquiry, pre-leasing administration, new lettings, rent reviews, leasing negotiation and documentation of the leasing proposal.
Prepare regular report on the overall leasing performance and business plan.
Undergo market research on the rental trend & occupancy rate.
Perform rental forecast, budgeting and expenses from agency, fitting-out and marketing activities. 

Requirements:

Degree holder in Real Estate, Surveying, Business Administration or related disciplines.
At least 12 years of solid experiences in leasing management of office portfolio in Hog Kong and preferably with over 5 years working at managerial grade. 
Proven track record working in renowned property developers with office leasing in Hong Kong. 
Strong networks with real estate agents and potential tenants. 
Energetic, highly motivated, strive for excellence and high level of accountability.
Excellent in inter-personal communication skill.
Proficient in both written and spoken English and Chinese.
Less experienced applicant would be considered as Leasing Manager.
This is an unique opportunity to work for a renowned property developer that continually drives and offers the upward potential for strong career progression throughout the organisation.  
In return, successful applicant will be offered a permanent position and receive a highly competitive salary package alongside market leading benefits with attractive performance bonus. If you are interested in this position, please send your updated resume to info @ rectrix-group.com

“Position”

About JLL –

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. As a Fortune 500 company, we help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. With us, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections and be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions - join us at JLL!

About the role:

To support deliver high quality, prompt and courteous Facility Management services in support of Client's business needs in a safe working environment.

What this job involves:

Chase daily work order status
Ad-hoc operation works Assistance
Support HACCP document preparation
Respond for housekeeping and daily building operation
Perform regular visual inspection to assure building condition in good shape
Respond stakeholders’ requests
Respond for supervising the daily supportive functions, including cleaning services, security services, repairs etc
Ensure day-to-day operation in managing portfolio in smooth and zero accident condition
Liaise with contractors and end-users for the implementation of repair and maintenance of building services
Manage and monitor the performance of service providers.
Support the general administration function of the team
Be Frist Aider

Sound like you? To apply you will have:

Higher Diploma / Degree in Building Studies, Facility Management and Property Management
A minimum of 2 years relevant working experience in the corporate real estate, facilities
Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
Good understanding of facilities / housekeeping management
Good command of both spoken and written English and Chinese
Basic computer skills in Microsoft Office, MS project, powerpoint, excel and Autocad
Independent, self-motivated, flexible, responsible and willing to work under pressure


 What you can expect from us

We’re an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. We succeed together - across the desk and around the globe. We believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, well-being, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.

With us, you’ll develop your strengths and enjoy a career full of varied experiences. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL.

Apply today!

Responsibilities


Implement leasing services for the Company portfolio of luxury residential buildings
Liaise with owners, tenants, property agents and other relevant parties for new lease and tenancy renewal;
Prepare, review, negotiate and finalize contracts/agreements and legal documentations with legal counsels and property agents
Handle tenant related inquiries, complaints and emergency issues
Explore what new services are popular to the residents
Liaise with market qualified service providers to explore any cooperation opportunity
Develop and execute new services implementation plan
Coordinate with PM team to ensure smooth new services implementation
Regularly review and evaluate the new services provision result and make improvement
Requirements

Tertiary educated in Property / Housing Management or related disciplines with at least 5 years’ relevant experience in property and/or clubhouse management
EAA license is an advantage
Outgoing with good negotiation, interpersonal and communication skills
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, proactive and able to work under pressure
Sound PC knowledge on MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Good command of both spoken and written English and Chinese including Putonghua
Outdoor work and shift duty on weekend and public holidays are required
We offer ample opportunities for career development and attractive salary package commensurate with experience and qualifications.  Interested parties please apply with full resume via “APPLY NOW”. 

For further information on Wheelock Properties (Hong Kong) Limited, please visit our website: www.wheelockpropertieshk.com.

We are an equal opportunities employer and invite applications from all qualified candidates. Personal data collected will be treated in strict confidence and handled by authorized persons for recruitment-related purposes only within The Wheelock & Wharf Group. Applicants not hearing from us within 2 months may consider their applications unsuccessful.
